data.title: Cannot access x and y component of IntVector2 (AngelScript)
data.body:
I want to access x and y value of graphics resolution by this code:

``` c
int resX = graphics.resolutions.x;
int resY = graphics.resolutions.y;
```

but it returns error:

```
'x' is not member of 'IntVector2[]'
```

Would be good to have people test on different devices, this fix works well on my android.

data.title: MouseMove causes LNK2019 error - VS2012
data.body:
I'm working on a project where using Urho3D CMake lists is not really an option. So, I created a new VS2012 project, added the header files, and included all the libs - and (with a bit of troubleshooting) the project builds and runs.

However, I was working on the camera behaviour and I added the line:

```
IntVector2 mouseMove = input->GetMouseMove();
```

All of a sudden I'm getting an unresolved external error (i.e. LNK2019).

```
Error   126 error LNK2019: unresolved external symbol "__declspec(dllimport) public: class Urho3D::IntVector2 const & __cdecl Urho3D::Input::GetMouseMove(void)const " (__imp_?GetMouseMove@Input@Urho3D@@QEBAAEBVIntVector2@2@XZ) referenced in function "private: void __cdecl VisualizationModule::MoveCamera(float)" (?MoveCamera@VisualizationModule@@AEAAXM@Z)    C:\Users\Daniel_office\Documents\git-repos\CyberstoneModules\UrhoTest\UrhoTest\VisualizationModule.obj
```

Given that the rest of the code works fine (setting up the engine, creating the scene, creating nodes) all works fine - this error puts me at a bit of a loss.

Any thoughts?

data.title: Allow to define techniques that should not be used on OpenGL ES.
data.body: Similar to defining techniques SM3-only for Direct3D, add a mechanism to define that a material technique should not be used on OpenGL ES, as those devices usually have limited graphics processing capability.

data.title: Change shader filename case (CopyFrambuffer to CopyFrameBuffer).
data.body: This will fix some post process problem on Linux.

data.title: SDK Cleanup #2
data.body:
Hi,

As mentioned in the previous discussion (See https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/pull/511), i have forked again and focused on a cleaner way to get a proper pull request. This time, close to no code in libraries has been changed, except for kNet as it has been said that it was already heavily tweaked for Urho3D.

This is the first step of future work on the project, to allow clean SDK for any platform the "standard" way. Eg for OSX, generation of a .framework with self-contained libs, headers, etc, with an unique INCLUDE_PATH as it's usually the case.

I have done the misstake of rebasing and squashing all my commits before pushing... Everything is in one single commit again. I have could re-do it using incremental commits as suggested by @weitjong if you prefer, now that i exactly have in mind what needs to be changed and in what order.

See commit message on commit 7797150 for infos:
Add TmpBuilds to SCM ignore list.
- Move AngelScript/include to AngelScript/include/AngelScript, and change CMake / Urho3D includes accordingly. In AngelScript source code, only as_config.h was changed.
- Move Bullet/include to Bullet/include/Bullet, and change CMake / Urho3D includes accordingly. No source file in Bullet was changed.
- Move kNet/include to kNet/include/kNet, and change CMake / Urho3D includes accordingly. Change most of the kNet source code include directives.
- Move SDL/include to SDL/include/SDL, and change CMake / Urho3D includes accordingly. A few auto-generated files (By original SDL configure script) were changed.

data.title: ColorCorrection post process returns black
data.body:
ColorCorrection post process returns black on both OpenGL and DirectX. There's no error on log. 
I tried to debug using GLSL shader and I found out that texture3D function failed to read LUTIdentity texture and always returns black. It looks like as if Urho pass wrong data to GPU.

data.title: ValueAnimation EventFrame
SDK cleanup for easier "from-scratch" usage.
data.body:
Changes in Source/ThirdParty to allow "#include <SomeLib/...>" from sources and user-code:
1) Moved "AngelScript/include/angelscript.h" to "AngelScript/include/AngelScript/angelscript.h".
2) Box2D looked clean and useable both from Source and from SDK the same way.
3) Moved "Bullet/src/*" to "Bullet/src/Bullet".
4) Moved "kNet/include" to "kNet/include/kNet".
5) Moved "SDL/include" to "SDL/include/SDL".
X) Should do Direct3D9 and OpenGL... Where to find them?

CMake files changed accordingly:
1) AngelScript:
- In AngelScript/CMakeLists.txt, the install directive copies things from AngelScript/include/AngelScript since it moved.
- From the Urho3D source files, replaced any "#include <angelscript.h>" with it's new counterpart (<AngelScript/angelscript.h>).
- Other various files changed:
  - "AngelScript/source/as_config.h": Inclusion fix (From "../include/angelscript.h" to "AngelScript/angelscript.h").
    FINAL NOTES: Zero changes done in the library code itself.

2) Box2D:
FINAL NOTES: Clean and SDK-compliant, nothing to be done here.

3) Bullet:
- In Bullet/CMakeLists.txt, replaced any occurence to "src" to match the new "src/Bullet".
- From the Urho3D source files, changed any bullet include reference to it's proper new counterpart (With the leading "Bullet/" prefix).
  FINAL NOTES: Many of the includes in Bullet were wrong relative to the file they were called.

4) kNet:
- In kNet/CMakeLists.txt, replaced any occurence to "include" to match the new "include/kNet", and added an include directive for it to build properly.
- From the Urho3D source files, changed any kNet include reference to it's proper counterpart. Especially, replaced all individual kNet/\* include by the global kNet.h or kNetFwd.h when required.
  FINAL NOTES: Most of the kNet includes were wrong... Very bad consistency from it's maintainer regarding relative paths. Most of them were re-written in the refactoring process, and since i've been told it was already a changed library, i hope it doesn't matters too much.

5) SDL:
- In SDL/CMakeLists.txt, changed the install directive to match the new SDL headers path.
- Added an include directive for SDL itself to be able to compile.
- Also changed to match the new scheme:
  - "SDL/src/events/SDL_touch_c.h": Inclusion fix.
- From the Urho3D source files, changed any reference to include SDL to match the new correct compatible scheme.
  FINAL NOTES: Just one file from the SDL itself was corrected. Easy to maintain.

data.title: ScrollView:: Auto disabling children when touch scrolling
data.body: This patch gives improved ScrollView control for touch devices, eg: You can set up a contact list like on iPhone where you start scrolling and you can no longer trigger the underlying elements.

data.title: Global anisotropic isn't working if using OpenGL
Provide accessor method on Scene to get the Camera component that has been specified as Default
data.body:
Provides an accessor method to get a "Default Camera" doesn't provide any functional impact but reduces the requirements to pass around or search for the Camera similar to the way scene is registered with Script for lookups.

Angelscript bindings included, lua not as I have no idea if the forward decl works with lua and can't register in a different order like you can in angelscript.

data.title: Ui drag update
data.body:
Changes to UI Drag behavior to allow making UI elements with more interesting drag behaviors (eg, multi-touch support, different behaviors for different button combinations, consistent drag cancel behaviors). A sample is also provided to demonstrate multi-touch support.

```
- Multi-touch drag support
- Combo touch support -- you get id mask of pressed buttons + number of buttons + the average of their positions (also, delta position in OnDragMove/E_DRAGMOVE).
- OnDrag* signature updates, with more information available and improved OnDragCancel / E_DRAGCANCEL support.
```

data.title: Input mouse cursor recall
data.body:
A change in behaviour to what happens when mouse is set to invisible and shown again. Previously the mouse would be re-centered to prevent errors in virtual cursor mode, however as shown in the example provided (second commit) it is useful to be able to 'recall' the previous position to prevent a 'jump' in the cursor control.

There is currently no public 'SetMouseCursor' function (reasons given [here](http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic400.html) and [here](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/urho3d/-VH3u2_sMHo/SscHwbuzVy0J) ), so this is one solution to keep in line with that.

An alternative solution might be to have a SetCursorVisible(bool, Cursor*), that way however your application controls the cursor, it can be restored to the cursor position.

data.title: Window position event and support create position via init parms
data.body:
Hello, me again :) Here is a clean version of what I sent earlier. Let me know if you want me to tweak something.

One thing that would make this a bit cleaner would be to change the initialization `position_(M_MAX_INT,M_MAX_INT)` to `position_(SDL_WINDOWPOS_UNDEFINED,SDL_WINDOWPOS_UNDEFINED)` then no further check against `M_MAX_INT` would be required. I didn't do this was not sure if that define fits inside a int, so played it safe.

Tested on windows and linux to send the event and create window to the initial position if init params are passed.

data.title: Graphics: Window position enhancements
data.body:
Hello everyone,

We are working on a project that will be using Urho3D mostly in windowed mode (https://github.com/realXtend/tundra-urho3d). There will be options to go fullscreen etc. later. In any case, I was implementing storing window position and size to config file so that we can open the window with same pos/size when you reopen the application.

**Problems I encountered**
- `E_SCREENMODE` does not provide window position.
- Querying `Graphics::GetWindowPosition()` returns a `IntVector2::ZERO` if the SDL window has been destroyed.
  - This is the case when I query the position on application exit if the user has closed the window from the `[x]` button in the window frame.
- Related to above, there is no event to listen "window about to be destroyed" so that users app could query the pos/size prior to the window being destroyed.
- `SDL_WINDOWEVENT_MOVED` was not handled by the `Input` system to notify `Graphics` of pos changes.

**Proposed solution**

I have implemented all the missing parts. `GetWindowPosition()` will still return `ZERO` vec if windows has been destroyed. But the new event params in `E_SCREENMODE` and new event `E_WINDOWABOUTTOCLOSE` are there to get info about changes and let you query before window destruction.

I am new to Urho3D and don't know your coding convention and naming schema that well. I did my best to respect the existing code style. Here are parts that you might have input on, please give it and I'll fix issues. Or say this kind of feature is not needed, thats fine too :)
- Are the new `WindowPositionX/Y` Engine init param names ok?
- Are the new `P_POSITION_X/Y` param names in `E_SCREENMODE` ok (could also be `P_X/Y`)? Is `E_SCREENMODE` even the right message for this data?
- I changed `int width_/height_` to `IntVector2 size_` and added new `IntVector2 position_`, Saw no meaningful reason for not to be a vector, except readability?
- Is the new event `E_WINDOWABOUTTOCLOSE` name ok? Is it a problem in terms of the `Context*` etc. that this event is sent in dtor? Both GL and D3D9 Graphics do this if window is not closed from the `[x]` button in the window frame.
  - Futhermore this might lead into dangerouns calls into the `Graphics` subsystem while it is in its dtor. I could not think of a more elegant solution. One option is to remove this event all together, but would sure be nice to know when the windows is being destroyed.
  - This could also be a non issue as I dont know the codebase. If `Graphics::Close` is always called prior to its destruction the current code should be ok (never sent from dtor).

Would appreciate comments feedback if you need changes. Cheers...

**Edit:** Tested the code on both Windows and Ubuntu. Ubuntu will reposition the window inside desktop if any parts of it goes out of bounds (at least from the bottom). Windows does not seem to reposition it automatically.

There might be a need for a utility for checking that initial create position is inside the desktop. Note that the position.x value can be negative. I have 3 monitors and my left most monitor has negative values as my center monitor is the main monitor for the OS.

data.title: [Added] Ability to create script object by specifying an interface it im...
asPEEK AngelScript debugger
data.body:
asPEEK debugger implementation. To use the debugger the build setting URHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT_DEBUGGING must be enabled and you'll have to grab a copy of the client from: https://bitbucket.org/saejox/aspeek/
To debug you're going to want to be running Urho in windowed mode.

I'm not terribly happy with the handling of C++ types, so that's likely to change heavily.

data.title: Drag slider for number lineedit in Editor
data.body:
![urhipullreq](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/765774/4749886/16ed9126-5a8b-11e4-980b-37d446c61e76.PNG)
I made additional button in Attribute Inspector & Material editor. I dont know what it called, let's say "drag slider". 
Inspiration is from Blender & Unity3D input number field. You can input a number without typing it. Just drag left to decreasing number & right to increasing the number.

data.title: Data should override CoreData
data.body:
One of things that really bothers me using Urho is CoreData is overriding Data. If I want to customize one of Urho default shader, I must do it on CoreData. I simply can't copy the shader, put it on Data folder, and edit them. CoreData is always overriding them.

One other problem is if I use editor from another folder and correctly set resource folder to my project path. If I use shader (or other assets) with same name as in CoreData, Urho will chose shader (or assets) on CoreData rather on my resource path. This is really annoying can confuse asset pipeline workflow.

In my opinion, CoreData shouldn't altered for production purpose. Data should always override CoreData. What do you guys think?

data.title: Fix Connection not sending delta update if only user variables have been modified
data.body:
Is it intentional that Connection does not send delta update if only user variables have been modified? If not, this should fix it.

I'm not actually using the Connection class, but rather my own implementation using Connection as a reference implementation. Because of that, I ended up with the same bug in my own implementation. 8)

data.title: Build will fail with several DirectX SDKs installed
data.body: If there are several DirectX SDK's, for example August 2009 and June 2010, the build process could pick the August SDK and fail due to missing D3DCompiler definitions.
